contentrichtext.text: {{BLP sources|date=October 2007}} {{Infobox person |image = | caption = | bgcolour = | name = Brook Kerr | birth_name = | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|1973|11|21}} | birth_place = [[Indianapolis, Indiana]], [[United States|U.S.]] | death_date = | occupation = Actress | spouse = Christopher Warren<br>(1992-present<br>separated 2009) | children = [[Chris Warren, Jr.]] }} '''Brook Kerr''' (born November 21, 1973) is an [[United States|American]] [[actress]] who is best known for her portrayal of [[Whitney Russell|Whitney Russell Harris]] on the [[television]] [[soap opera]] ''[[Passions]]''. ==Biography== She is a native of [[Indianapolis, Indiana]]. Kerr moved to [[Los Angeles, California|Los Angeles]] after graduating high school to pursue a career in acting. She has lived there ever since. She had her son when she was 16 years old with long-time boyfriend Christopher Warren.<ref>http://www.imdb.com/name/nm0449656/bio</ref> Kerr and Warren have been together since their teens, but separated in 2009.<ref>http://www.tmz.com/2012/08/01/passions-brook-kerr-divorce/ Brook Kerr files for Divorce From Chris Warren</ref> Her son [[Chris Warren, Jr.]] is also an actor, he has appeared as Zeke in ''[[High School Musical]]'', ''[[High School Musical 2]]'', and ''[[High School Musical 3]]''. She is featured in [[Kenny Chesney]]'s video for his new single "[[Everybody Wants to Go to Heaven]]". She was also in [[3T]]'s music video "Why" feat. [[Michael Jackson]] in 1995. Kerr's mother currently serves as a receptionist for [[Governor of Indiana|Indiana Governor]] [[Mitch Daniels]]{{Citation needed|date=October 2007}}. ==Career== Kerr has played the character of Whitney Russell Harris since the shows debut in 1999 and is considered one of its veteran stars. She exited the role of Whitney on September 6, 2007, the second to last day the show aired on NBC but returned for the show's finale episodes briefly from Mid-July 2008 to early August 2008 in a guest appearance.{{citation needed|date=October 2010}} In 2008, she starred as [[Tara Thornton]] in the unaired first pilot of the HBO TV series ''[[True Blood]]'', and was subsequently replaced by [[Rutina Wesley]] for that role. ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== *{{IMDb name|id=0449656|name=Brook Kerr}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME =Kerr, Brook | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = American actor | DATE OF BIRTH =1973-11-21 | PLACE OF BIRTH =[[Indianapolis, Indiana]], [[United States|U.S.]] | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Kerr, Brook}} [[Category:1973 births]] [[Category:American soap opera actresses]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:People from Indianapolis, Indiana]] [[Category:Actresses from Indiana]] [[Category:African-American actresses]] {{US-tv-actor-1970s-stub}}
